properties.areaDesc: Northern Humboldt Coast; Coastal Del Norte
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 16 at 3:55AM PST until January 16 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...Periods of heavy rainfall through early morning...

.Additional showers are expected this morning, some moderate to
heavy at times. With persistent rain over the last week, creeks
and streams are already elevated. This additional rainfall will
likely result in some small streams and creeks overtopping their
banks on the coastal plain. Localized urban flooding will also be
possible. Farther inland, snow will continue in the mountains
resulting in a lower threat of flooding.

The Flood Watch continues for

* A portion of northwest California, including the following
areas, Coastal Del Norte and Northern Humboldt Coast.

* Until noon today.

* One to two inches of rain is expected on top of saturated
soils. This will result in rising small streams and creeks
with some overtopping their banks. Localized urban flooding
will also be possible. Main stem river flooding is not
expected.

* Some creeks and streams that may flood include Jacoby Creek,
Elk River, Freshwater Creek, Coffee Creek, Hookton Slough,
Martin Slough, and other low-lying areas. Some roads that may
be impacted in Humboldt County include Berta Road, Coffee
Creek Road, Hookton Road, Howard Heights Road, Myrtle Avenue,
Old Arcata Road, and Graham Road. Lake Earl Drive near the
Smith River, Fred D Haight Drive, and other low lying areas
may see flooding in Del Norte County.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON TODAY
